item.title: Mattress dumped on street corner, 12th July
item.description:
The mattress is still there. It's just been moved. It's now leaning up against the wall of the corner house. See photo one. Can it be removed please. It's been there 10 days now. Corner of Crescent Road and Frederick Road!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1a, Frederick Place, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised footpatg, 12th July
item.description:
Across the entire width of the main pavement before you turn into the private land for Sainsbury’s, all the footpath (flags) have raised up causing a serious trip hazard for everyone. It has been like this for at least 2 weeks now and is causing issues for members of the public with disabilities and mobility issues
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bugsby's Way, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two instances of large-scale graffiti saying "DEATH TO THE IDF'., 12th July
item.description:
On the underpass beneath Wells Way and on the new wall in the eastern section of Burgess Park in large black capital letters there are two instances of graffiti saying "DEATH TO THE IDF'. This will have been written sometime in July. Please remove this as it will only inflame tensions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wells Way, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black bag full of rubbish dumped bt the tree opposite no 3, 12th July
item.description:
The rubbish bag has been by the tree for about a week opposite No 3 Coopersale Rd and is attracting more litter. The bag has been 'vandalised' by foxes
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Coopersale Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Traffic signals and road markings unclear, 12th July
item.description:
It seems like the road layout might have changed recently, the previous road markings are on the road and if there are new road markings it's not clear which is which, this means that a driver does not know where to stop there are 3 traffic lights and either a previous or a new line, so what happens is when going northbound on lower road outside seven islands leisure centre there is what seems to be a previous road line and a previous cycle box, which has been covered, badly as it is partly visable but difficult to know which is the correct lines to follow, then 5-10 metres after that there is one traffic light, so a driver continues to that traffic light but now there is no line, so a driver doesn't know where to stop, further on from this traffic light there are two more traffic lights but again no. Stop line, there is traffic coming from the right and it's dangerous as the driver doesn't know where to. Stop, looking on Google this seems like it used to be a yellow box and no cycle lanes 2025 Google and has now changed to a protected 2 way cycle lane this year 2025, Are the road markings not yet updated as it is unclear where to stop, 5 metres before the first light, at the first light or at the second set of red lights? There are no road marking to. Indicate where exactly to stop

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet
